thread.title: Attorney of dismissed UGA, Alabama lineman still hoping for resolution in felony domestic violence case
thread.title_full: Attorney of dismissed UGA, Alabama lineman still hoping for resolution in felony domestic violence case

author: Marc Weiszer
title: Attorney of dismissed UGA, Alabama lineman still hoping for resolution in felony domestic violence case
text:
Attorney of dismissed UGA, Alabama lineman still hoping for resolution in felony domestic violence case 
Jonathan Taylor, the defensive lineman booted from both Georgia and Alabama, had a court date on Thursday morning in Athens for his felony domestic violence case stemming from his July 2014 arrest. 
The case was continued until April 2016 after a status conference, according to Kim Stephens, Taylor’s attorney. 
Stephens said he is working on a resolution on the case with the District Attorney’s office that he hopes will come before the end of 2015. 
“We have not gotten to that point yet, but will continue to try to do that,” Stephens said. 
Taylor is charged with aggravated assault, battery and simpley battery. He entered a not guilty plea in April. Police say the 6-foot-5, 335-pound Taylor choked and struck his then girlfriend several times on July 22, 2014 with a closed fist at UGA’s McWhorter Hall. 
Taylor was dismissed from Georgia after the incident and enrolled last January at Alabama after playing a season at Copiah-Lincoln Community College in Mississippi. 
Taylor was arrested again on March 28 in Tuscaloosa after another girlfriend accused him of assaulting her and Alabama also dismissed him. She recanted her story and was arrested for filing a false police report, but that was dismissed on July 7, the same day that Taylor pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor count of criminal mischief, according ESPN’s Outside the Lines. 
Taylor is enrolled at Southeastern Louisiana, but not playing this season.
